title: Argument sparked shooting that killed 1 teen, wounded 2, Muskegon chief says
content:
MUSKEGON, MI - An argument led one man to pull out and fire a gun, killing one male teen and wounding two others Saturday evening, Muskegon Police Chief Jeffrey Lewis said Sunday.
Investigators believe the shooter is still at large, and that he fired the only shots - it's not believed to have turned into a gun battle, Lewis told MLive around 10 a.m. June 19.
"An apparent argument sparked one man to pull and fire his weapon," Lewis said. "No arrests, we are making progress at this time."
The identities of the victims have not been released pending notification of relatives.
The shooting was reported at 8:06 p.m. Saturday, June 18, in the 900 block of East Isabella Avenue in Muskegon between Eastgate and Madison streets. That's about a block east of Getty Street and two blocks south of Apple Avenue, just west of Sheldon Park.
Muskegon police found three victims lying in a yard.
A 17-year-old died after being transported to a local hospital, police said. Two 18-year-olds were shot in the torso and transported to a hospital.
The two wounded men are recovering, Lewis said Sunday morning.
Officers were speaking with several "persons of interest" and witnesses, according to the news release.
The police ask anyone with information to call the Muskegon Police Department at 231-724-6750 or Silent Observer at 231-722-7463.
